record.name: by
record.description: IP-address of incoming interface of a proxy

record.name: for
record.description: IP-address of client making a request through a proxy

record.name: host
record.description: Host header field of the incoming request

record.name: proto
record.description: Application protocol used for incoming request

record.name: respond-async
record.description: Indicates that the client prefers that the server respond asynchronously to a request.

record.name: return
record.description: When the value is "minimal", it indicates that the client prefers that the server return a minimal response to a request. When the value is "representation", it indicates that the client prefers that the server include a representation of the current state of the resource in response to a request.

record.name: wait
record.description: Indicates an upper bound to the length of time the client expects it will take the server to process the request once it has been received.

record.name: handling
record.description: When value is "strict", it indicates that the client wishes the server to apply strict validation and error handling to the processing of a request. When the value is "lenient", it indicates that the client wishes the server to apply lenient validation and error handling to the processing of the request.

record.name: depth-noroot
record.description: The "depth-noroot" preference indicates that the client wishes for the server to exclude the target (root) resource from processing by the HTTP method and only apply the HTTP method to the target resource's subordinate resources. This preference is only intended to be used with HTTP methods whose definitions explicitly provide support for the "Depth" header field. Furthermore, this preference only applies when the "Depth" header field has a value of "1" or "infinity" (either implicitly or explicitly).

record.name: bytes
record.description: a range of octets

record.name: none
record.description: reserved as keyword, indicating no ranges are supported
